abstracts.cdata!:
The achievement of project objectives,
            is judged to be highly satisfactory, having increased
            farming productivity, and incomes, while reducing rural
            poverty, with substantial improvements in irrigation, and
            drainage management, and, sustainability is likely. Among
            the lessons drawn from the project, it is suggested that,
            sometimes, a crisis situation can generate success, as was
            the development of the water user associations (WUAs), which
            as a result of collapsing cooperatives, and state farms into
            unorganized private farms, produced a consensus among
            policymakers, and farmers to initiate participatory
            irrigation management, further enabling strong community
            participation. The uniqueness of the WUAs in Albania, lies
            in their private voluntary approach, de facto, a community
            ownership of irrigation, isolated from political pressures,
            which provides incentives for increased administrative
            transparency, with promising results. Although the project
            provided technical assistance for irrigation practices, it
            was made clear that WUAs should finance major equipment,
            professional, and maintenance services, which strengthened
            the communes' governance. The government's
            commitment for a supportive legal framework, enabled the
            development of WUAs, which might have otherwise been
            hampered by political pressures, and interference from water enterprises.
